result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael D Willis

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.

02:26 PM/Rm. 301/Defendant Michael D Willis in court with attorney John Zich.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties and reporter by Zoom.  Def. advised he will have to request to appear by Zoom in the future.  Def. has copy of complaint, waives reading.  Def. waives time limits for PH.  Discussion about waiving time limits.  Court accepts waiver of time limits.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 03:32 PM Defendant Michael D Willis in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael D Willis appeared by video means, via zoom.   Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. would like counsel.  CC direct def. to contact P.D.  Bond continues.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No illegal use or possession of controlled substances, Maintain Absolute Sobriety,  No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license.  No possession of firarms. & No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

3-18-22
Court call @ 1:04 pm. 
State of WI vs. Michael D. Willis
Judge John B. Rhode
Elizabeth Gebert, via zoom
Jackie Lenaker, CR, via zoom
Def. appears  in custody & via zoom 

State gives bases for why def. held in custody and gives facts.
 Possible charges: Possession of Narcotic Drugs, Carry Concealed Weapon, & OWI 3rd
State gives bail/bond recommendations $2500 cash bond No illegal use or possession of controlled substances, Maintain Absolute Sobriety,  No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license.  No firearms No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Def. advised of attorney rights. 
Court orders $2,000 cash bond with conditions No illegal use or possession of controlled substances, Maintain Absolute Sobriety,  No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license.  No possession of firarms. & No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Init Appearance 3-21-22 @ 1:30
